Program Name: Community Servings – Medically Tailored Meals & Nutrition (MA/RI)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): People with severe, complex and/or chronic illness (e.g., diabetes, HIV, cancer, kidney disease) and food insecurity
Population Engaged: 6,866 individuals served in FY24 (overall); 5,621 individuals served via healthcare contracts in FY24
Partners: MassHealth ACOs and other health plans/health systems
community health centers (see annual report for partner list)
Intervention Description: Home-delivered medically tailored meals designed by RDNs; nutrition assessments/counseling; care coordination with healthcare partners
Duration / Scale: Ongoing; statewide/regional; healthcare contracts plus direct service
Funding Source: Healthcare contracts (including Medicaid Flexible Services Program); philanthropy; grants
Measured Outcomes: Diet quality; food security; healthcare utilization and costs; clinical outcomes (e.g., A1c, BP) where evaluated
Evaluation Results (if published): Peer-reviewed and other evaluations report improved diet quality and associations with reduced admissions and lower medical spending (see linked JAMA Internal Medicine and JGIM publications).
Data Source / Last Updated: Community Servings FY24 Annual Report; peer-reviewed literature; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Community Servings: Food as Medicine for Diabetes (Clinical Trial)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Adults with type 2 diabetes, elevated HbA1c (>8.0%), and food insecurity
Intervention Description: Home delivery of 10 medically tailored meals/week for 12 weeks (cross-over design) versus usual care
Measured Outcomes: Dietary quality; HbA1c; food security (per study design)
Evaluation Results (if published): Randomized cross-over trial published in Journal of General Internal Medicine (see link).
Data Source / Last Updated: Peer-reviewed literature and ClinicalTrials.gov; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Food Is Medicine Massachusetts (FIMMA) Coalition
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Massachusetts residents affected by diet-related illness and food insecurity (systems-level initiative)
Intervention Description: Coalition convening and strategy work to expand access to Food Is Medicine interventions and advance research/policy
Measured Outcomes: Not Available
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: Community Servings state plan page; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: MassHealth Flexible Services Program – Nutrition Supports (MA Medicaid)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Eligible MassHealth members served via ACOs with health-related social needs (including nutrition supports)
Partners: Community Servings and other nutrition service providers
Intervention Description: ACOs can partner with nutrition providers to offer nutrition supports including medically tailored meals (as described by Community Servings annual report and related research)
Funding Source: Medicaid Section 1115 waiver / Flexible Services Program
Measured Outcomes: Health outcomes and utilization/cost where evaluated
Evaluation Results (if published): Evaluation consortium and related analyses reported in literature and program reports; see Health Affairs article and Community Servings annual report for context.
Data Source / Last Updated: Community Servings annual report and AMPL research pages; Health Affairs article; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Geisinger Fresh Food Farmacy
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Patients with diabetes (HbA1c > 8.0) and food insecurity (and their households, per program descriptions)
Population Engaged: Nearly 600 individuals (reported); initial pilot ~250+ in year 1 (reported in program materials)
Geography: Pennsylvania (northeastern PA; initial site Shamokin/Kulpmont region)
Intervention Description: Weekly access to healthy foods to prepare meals plus diabetes education and clinical support; “food-as-medicine” referral by primary care
Duration / Scale: Ongoing; multi-site health system program; RCT registered on ClinicalTrials.gov
Funding Source: Health system/plan funding; research grants (see trial/grant pages)
Measured Outcomes: HbA1c; BMI; BP; lipids; diabetes self-management; healthcare utilization/cost
Evaluation Results (if published): Program described in NEJM Catalyst and PubMed; trial registered on ClinicalTrials.gov; reports of improvements in HbA1c and other biomarkers.
Data Source / Last Updated: Geisinger program pages; NEJM Catalyst; PubMed; ClinicalTrials.gov; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: DC Greens Produce Rx
Population Targeted (can be multiple): DC Medicaid-enrolled patients with diet-related chronic illness (per program description)
Intervention Description: Monthly funds on a preloaded produce prescription card for six months to purchase fruits and vegetables at participating grocery retailers
Measured Outcomes: Fruit and vegetable intake; BMI/weight; patient experience (per cited evaluations/overviews)
Evaluation Results (if published): Program evaluations summarized in DC-related reports; see program page and related evaluation references.
Data Source / Last Updated: DC Greens program page and related evaluation references; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Produce Plus (Washington, DC)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): People receiving federal benefits / low-income DC residents (per program descriptions)
Intervention Description: Produce benefit (vouchers or electronic benefits) redeemable for fruits and vegetables at participating markets/retail
Measured Outcomes: Fruit and vegetable intake; program participation and redemption
Evaluation Results (if published): Evaluation materials available from FRESHFARM and partner evaluations.
Data Source / Last Updated: FRESHFARM evaluation page; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Wholesome Wave Georgia – Fruit and Vegetable Prescription (FVRx®) Program
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Patients served by participating clinical/community sites (e.g., FQHCs/hospitals) at risk for diet-related disease (see evaluation report)
Geography: Georgia (multiple sites including Atlanta area, per evaluation report)
Partners: Clinical sites and community partners listed in evaluation report
Intervention Description: Produce prescriptions / incentives to increase fruit and vegetable purchasing and consumption, paired with education and community access points
Measured Outcomes: Fruit and vegetable intake; food security; clinical/behavior outcomes (per evaluation)
Evaluation Results (if published): 2016 evaluation report summarizes implementation and outcomes.
Data Source / Last Updated: Wholesome Wave Georgia evaluation report; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: USDA Gus Schumacher Nutrition Incentive Program (GusNIP) – Produce Prescription Program
Organization / Lead Entity: USDA National Institute of Food and Agriculture (NIFA)
Setting / Sector: Federal grant program; Community-based; Healthcare delivery
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Varies by funded project
generally participants eligible due to diet-related health risk/condition and food insecurity (per program description)
Intervention Description: Competitive grants supporting projects that prescribe fruits and vegetables to improve diet, reduce food insecurity, and reduce healthcare use/cost
Measured Outcomes: Dietary intake; food insecurity; healthcare use/cost (program goal)
Evaluation Results (if published): Multi-site pooled analyses and other evaluations published (see example JAMA-style pooled analysis link).
Data Source / Last Updated: USDA NIFA program pages; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Nutrition Incentive Hub – GusNIP Grantee Project Directory
Population Targeted (can be multiple): GusNIP grantees and stakeholders
Intervention Description: Public directory of GusNIP-funded projects and resources
Measured Outcomes: Not Available
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: Nutrition Incentive Hub grantee directory; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: National Produce Prescription Collaborative (NPPC)
Organization / Lead Entity: NPPC (coalition; co-founded by Wholesome Wave and others)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Produce prescription implementers and policymakers
Intervention Description: Coalition advancing policy and implementation to integrate produce prescriptions into clinical care and public programs
Measured Outcomes: Not Available
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: NPPC website; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Food is Medicine Coalition (FIMC)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Nonprofit MTM/MTG providers and stakeholders
Partners: Member agencies (e.g., Community Servings, Project Angel Food, Food & Friends, MANNA, etc.)
Intervention Description: Coalition supporting policy, research, and best practices for medically tailored meals and related services
Measured Outcomes: Not Available
Evaluation Results (if published): Publishes/curates research lists and standards (see links).
Data Source / Last Updated: FIMC website; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Boston Medical Center – Preventive Food Pantry
Population Targeted (can be multiple): BMC patients with nutrition-related illness/undernutrition
low-income patients referred by providers
Intervention Description: Clinic-referred pantry where providers write “prescriptions” for supplemental foods aligned to needs; part of broader food and nutrition programs
Measured Outcomes: Not Available
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: Boston Medical Center program page; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Boston Medical Center Fresh Connect (Produce Prescription Study)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): BMC patients enrolled in study (produce prescription via smart card
see NIFA project page)
Intervention Description: Participants receive a smart card loaded with produce prescription funds (e.g., $30) as part of research intervention
Measured Outcomes: Fruit and vegetable intake; clinical outcomes (per study design)
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: NIFA project page; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Kaiser Permanente – Food Prescriptions Study (Southern California)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Kaiser Permanente adult members (18+) interested in weight loss with a child in household (eligibility per study site)
Intervention Description: Study of produce prescriptions / food prescriptions for eligible members (see study site)
Measured Outcomes: Weight-related and diet outcomes (per study materials)
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: KP research study site; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Kaiser Permanente – Food Is Medicine Center of Excellence
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Patients and communities impacted by diet-related disease (system-level initiative)
Intervention Description: Center of Excellence to scale and study food as medicine interventions such as medically tailored meals and produce prescriptions
Measured Outcomes: Not Available
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: Kaiser Permanente press release; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Houston Food Bank – FoodRx (Food for Change Markets)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Individuals referred by healthcare partners or participating in community health programs
Partners: Healthcare partners and community-based organizations (see partnerships page)
Intervention Description: Referred participants redeem FoodRx twice per month at Food For Change Markets for 30+ lbs of nutritious food; includes nutrition education materials
Measured Outcomes: Redemption and program engagement; health outcomes in evaluation reports (see UTHealth evaluation brief)
Evaluation Results (if published): UTHealth evaluation brief report available (see link).
Data Source / Last Updated: Houston Food Bank program pages and evaluation briefs; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Children's Hospital of Philadelphia (CHOP) – Food Pharmacy
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Food-insecure families with children served by CHOP programs (including Healthy Weight Program, per CHOP news)
Partners: Community food partners (e.g., Share Food Program, Sharing Excess) per CHOP resources
Intervention Description: Families receive groceries monthly for 6 months (per program page)
Measured Outcomes: Food security and nutrition behaviors (program intent)
Evaluation Results (if published): Program descriptions and outcomes highlighted by CHOP; see CHOP news release.
Data Source / Last Updated: CHOP program pages; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: California Medi-Cal – Medically Tailored Meals Pilot Program (CHF)
Organization / Lead Entity: California Department of Health Care Services (DHCS)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): High-utilizing Medi-Cal beneficiaries with congestive heart failure (CHF) (per DHCS)
Population Engaged: Planned to serve 1,413 beneficiaries over four years (program page); enrollment totals vary by participating agency
Partners: Participating agencies include Mama’s Kitchen, The Health Trust, Ceres Community Project (per pilot webinar slides and DHCS materials)
Intervention Description: Up to three medically tailored meals per day for 12 weeks, plus nutrition therapy (varies by agency); designed to reduce institutionalization and improve outcomes
Funding Source: State Medicaid program funding (pilot budget reported by DHCS)
Measured Outcomes: Hospitalizations; institutionalizations; health outcomes; utilization/cost
Evaluation Results (if published): Final legislative evaluation report available (see DHCS evaluation PDF).
Data Source / Last Updated: DHCS program page and evaluation report; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Project Angel Food – Medically Tailored Meals (Los Angeles)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): People facing serious illness in Los Angeles County who are unable to shop/cook (varied diagnoses
see general info)
Population Engaged: Approx. 5,272 individuals served (reported) and ~1.5+ million meals/year (reported)
Intervention Description: Preparation and home delivery of medically tailored meals; multiple therapeutic menus
Measured Outcomes: Patient health outcomes and cost/utilization where evaluated
Evaluation Results (if published): Participated in California Medi-Cal MTM pilot evaluated by DHCS (see evaluation report).
Data Source / Last Updated: Project Angel Food program pages; DHCS evaluation report; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Mama's Kitchen – Medically Tailored Meal Service (San Diego)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): People in San Diego County affected by HIV, cancer, heart disease, type 2 diabetes, chronic kidney disease who are unable to prepare meals (per program page)
Intervention Description: Free home delivery of three medically tailored meals per day for every day of the week/year; includes RDN education/coaching
Measured Outcomes: Nutrition security; health outcomes and utilization where evaluated
Evaluation Results (if published): Participating agency in California Medi-Cal MTM pilot (CHF) (see pilot materials).
Data Source / Last Updated: Mama's Kitchen program pages; DHCS pilot materials; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Ceres Community Project – Medically Tailored Meals
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Patients with chronic and acute illnesses (e.g., diabetes, CHF, cancer, COPD) referred by medical professional/plan
Geography: California (service areas vary); statewide pilot described for Medi-Cal CHF members
Intervention Description: Home-delivered medically tailored meals (7–21 per week depending on contract) plus RDN sessions; participates in Medi-Cal MTM pilot and other studies
Funding Source: Contracts; Medicaid pilot funding; philanthropy (Not Available)
Measured Outcomes: Health outcomes and utilization/cost depending on project; CHF pilot outcomes
Evaluation Results (if published): California statewide Medi-Cal CHF pilot details and results posted by Ceres; DHCS evaluation report also available.
Data Source / Last Updated: Ceres program and pilot pages; DHCS evaluation report; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: The Health Trust – Medi-Cal Medically Tailored Meals Pilot (Santa Clara / Southern San Mateo)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Eligible Medi-Cal beneficiaries with CHF meeting pilot criteria (adult
recent utilization
residing in Santa Clara County or Southern San Mateo County, per pilot slides)
Geography: Santa Clara County and Southern San Mateo County, California
Intervention Description: MTM delivery initiated after discharge; includes RDN medical nutrition therapy sessions (per pilot flyer/slides)
Measured Outcomes: Hospital/ER use; readmissions; health outcomes; institutionalization
Evaluation Results (if published): DHCS final evaluation report includes pilot evaluation.
Data Source / Last Updated: Pilot materials and DHCS evaluation report; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: California Medi-Cal (CalAIM) – Community Supports: Medically Supportive Food & Nutrition
Organization / Lead Entity: California Department of Health Care Services (DHCS)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Eligible Medi-Cal members meeting Community Supports criteria (including nutrition-sensitive conditions
eligibility varies)
Geography: California (statewide, by managed care plan implementation)
Intervention Description: Community Supports include medically supportive food and nutrition services such as medically tailored meals (service definitions and implementation vary by MCP/provider)
Measured Outcomes: Member outcomes and utilization (varies; program-level monitoring)
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: DHCS CalAIM Community Supports page; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: North Carolina Healthy Opportunities Pilot (HOP) – Food Services
Organization / Lead Entity: NC Medicaid / NC DHHS (1115 waiver pilot)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Eligible Medicaid members in pilot regions with health-related social needs (food domain)
Intervention Description: Food services included produce prescriptions, healthy food boxes/meals, medically tailored meal delivery, nutrition classes, and case management (per NC Medicaid)
Duration / Scale: Pilot launched March 2022; services stopped July 1, 2025 due to funding (per partner notice)
Measured Outcomes: Health outcomes, utilization, and social needs (pilot evaluation ongoing/varies)
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: NC Medicaid blog and partner program notice; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Food & Friends – Medically Tailored Meals and Nutrition Services
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Individuals with serious illnesses (e.g., HIV/AIDS, cancer, diabetes, heart and renal disease) and their families/caregivers
Population Engaged: 5,476 people served and 1,892,540 medically tailored meals provided in 2023 (reported)
Intervention Description: Home-delivered medically tailored meals and groceries plus nutrition counseling; weekly deliveries
Measured Outcomes: Client health and well-being; utilization/cost in studies (Not Available)
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: Food & Friends website; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: MANNA – Medically Tailored Meals and Nutrition Education
Population Targeted (can be multiple): People in Greater Philadelphia area battling serious illness
Intervention Description: Home-delivered medically tailored meals with diet modifications; nutrition education
Duration / Scale: Ongoing; time-limited eligibility per client need
Measured Outcomes: Not Available
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: MANNA website; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Moveable Feast – Medically Tailored Meals and Medical Nutrition Therapy
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Marylanders experiencing food insecurity and serious chronic illness
Population Engaged: Nearly 2,500 Marylanders served and >420,000 meals served in 2024 (reported)
Geography: Baltimore City and 14 Maryland counties (per program page)
Partners: CRISP (Maryland HIE) and healthcare providers (per annual report)
Intervention Description: Weekly delivery of medically tailored meals; may include produce and supplements; RDN support
Funding Source: Government grants; healthcare contracts; philanthropy (per annual report)
Measured Outcomes: Malnutrition risk; self-reported health; healthcare cost data linkage (per annual report)
Evaluation Results (if published): Annual report notes data collection; published study includes MTM managed by Moveable Feast in Baltimore (see PubMed Central link).
Data Source / Last Updated: Moveable Feast annual report and related literature; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: God's Love We Deliver – Medically Tailored Meals
Population Targeted (can be multiple): People living with HIV/AIDS, cancer, and other serious illnesses who cannot shop/cook (per annual report)
Geography: New York City (5 boroughs) and parts of NJ/Long Island/Westchester (per annual report)
Partners: Healthcare contracts and community partners (Not Available)
Intervention Description: Home-delivered medically tailored meals plus illness-specific nutrition education and counseling; free regardless of income
Measured Outcomes: Utilization/cost and health outcomes in literature; nutrition counseling and education reach
Evaluation Results (if published): Publishes research/policy resources; program referenced in MTM research literature; see annual report and research page.
Data Source / Last Updated: GLWD FY2023 annual report; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Open Hand Atlanta – Medically Tailored Meals
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Individuals living with severe, complex and/or chronic illnesses through referral (per program description)
Geography: Atlanta metro / Georgia (service area Not Available)
Intervention Description: Frozen medically tailored meals delivered to doorsteps; diet-specific menus designed by RDNs
Measured Outcomes: Health outcomes and patient satisfaction (program intent)
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available
Data Source / Last Updated: Open Hand Atlanta website; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Open Arms of Minnesota – Medically Tailored Meal Delivery
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Minnesota residents living with life-threatening illness (e.g., HIV/AIDS, cancer, ALS, MS, ESRD, CHF, COPD) and their families (per program descriptions)
Population Engaged: Nearly 5,000 people and ~1.5 million meals in 2023 (reported)
Intervention Description: Medically tailored meal preparation and delivery guided by RDNs; includes support for caregivers/dependents
Measured Outcomes: Not Available
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available

Program Name: Lifelong – Chicken Soup Brigade (Medically Tailored Meals & Groceries)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Low-income and underserved people in King County with nutrition-related diseases (per program page)
Geography: King County, Washington (and broader via partnerships, per external descriptions)
Intervention Description: Prepare and deliver medically tailored meals and groceries; nutrition support services
Measured Outcomes: Not Available
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available

Program Name: Project Open Hand – Wellness Program (Medically Tailored Meals & Groceries)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Clients living with critical illness (e.g., HIV/AIDS, heart disease, diabetes) and seniors/adults with disabilities (per program pages)
Population Engaged: >2,500 meals prepared daily and groceries for >200 clients/day (reported; not unique individuals)
Geography: San Francisco Bay Area (San Francisco and Oakland)
Partners: Health plans (e.g., SF Health Plan program example)
Intervention Description: Pickup or home-delivered medically tailored meals; weekly fresh groceries; community nutrition programs
Measured Outcomes: Not Available

Program Name: Fresh Prescription (Fresh Rx) Program – Detroit, MI
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Low-income patients with diabetes in Detroit, MI (per RCT publication abstract)
Intervention Description: 15-week produce prescription program designed to improve access and consumption of fruits and vegetables
Measured Outcomes: Fruit and vegetable intake; diabetes-related outcomes (per RCT)
Evaluation Results (if published): Pilot RCT published in 2021 (see link).
Data Source / Last Updated: Peer-reviewed literature; last updated 2026-01-05

Program Name: Food Is Medicine Institute @ Tufts University
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Researchers, policymakers, implementers (evidence and projects)
Intervention Description: Research, evaluation, and dissemination hub for Food Is Medicine interventions and policy
Measured Outcomes: Not Available
Evaluation Results (if published): Not Available

Program Name: Multi-site Produce Prescription Pooled Evaluation (22 program locations) – Tufts/Wholesome Wave collaboration
Organization / Lead Entity: Tufts Food Is Medicine Institute / collaborators (see publication)
Population Targeted (can be multiple): Adults and children participating in produce prescription programs across 22 U.S. locations (per publication)
Population Engaged: Not Available (programs pooled; study includes multiple sites)
Intervention Description: Pooled analysis of produce prescription participation and outcomes
Measured Outcomes: Fruit and vegetable intake; food insecurity; self-reported health; HbA1c, BP, BMI among adults with poor cardiometabolic health
Evaluation Results (if published): Published pooled analysis in 2023 (see PMC link).
Data Source / Last Updated: Peer-reviewed literature; last updated 2026-01-05
